intro: Glossocardia bidens, commonly known as the two-toothed glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. Glossocardia bidens thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands.
